articles.title: Appeals court bars Trump from deploying National Guard in Illinois - The Washington Post
articles.description: The appeals court weighed in after a federal judge, concluding that it was “likely to lead to civil unrest,” barred the president from deploying troops in and around Chicago.

articles.title: China defends rare earth export curbs as ‘legitimate,’ hits back at U.S. tariffs as Trump-Xi meeting hangs in balance - CNBC
articles.description: The Chinese Ministry of Commerce said the controls, issued Oct. 9, were part of Beijing's effort to "better safeguard world peace and regional stability."

articles.title: 5 thoughts from Texas-Oklahoma: Arch Manning outduels John Mateer in Red River upset - Dallas News
articles.description: With their upset of No. 6 Oklahoma, the Longhorns have kept their College Football Playoff hopes alive.

articles.description: The actor, known for her quirky, vibrant manner and depth was 79. Across her decades-long career, she worked with prominent filmmakers including Francis Ford Coppola, Woody Allen and Nancy Meyers.

articles.title: HHS rehiring some people fired through reduction-in-force efforts - Politico
articles.description: A Trump administration legal document said HHS initially targeted 1,000 to 1,200 employees for dismissal, and people speaking with POLITICO say the firings focused on the CDC.

articles.title: Allar injured, out for year as PSU's skid hits 3 - ESPN
articles.description: Penn State quarterback Drew Allar, who left the Nittany Lions' stunning 22-21 loss to Northwestern on Saturday, is out for the season, coach James Franklin said in his postgame media availability, not long after his reeling team fell to 3-3.

articles.title: Trump orders Defense Dept. to issue military paychecks during shutdown - The Washington Post
articles.description: Trump said that the Pentagon would repurpose money to make payroll, as military service members were poised to miss paychecks on Wednesday. Most other government workers will not be paid.

articles.description: "If it continues on its current path, it could reach $10,000 before the end of the decade."

articles.description: “We don’t have enough cops, so if they can be cops, I’m all for it,” Benioff told The New York Times on Friday.
